about.summary: Variables are the fundamental parts of each programming language but handling them efficiently might be frustrating for programmers. This package contains some functions to help user (especially data explorers) to make more sense of their variables and take the most out of variables and hardware resources. These functions are written, collected and crafted over 7 years of experience in statistical data analysis on high-dimensional data, and for each of them there was a need. Functions in this package are suppose to be efficient and easy to use, hence they will be frequently updated to make them more convenient.

Variables are the fundamental parts of each programming language but handling them efficiently might be frustrating for programmers. This package contains some functions to help user (especially data explorers) to make more sense of their variables and take the most out of variables and hardware resources. These functions are written, collected and crafted over 7 years of experience in statistical data analysis on high-dimensional data, and for each of them there was a need. Functions in this package are suppose to be efficient and easy to use, hence they will be frequently updated to make them more convenient.

name: r-varhandle
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.0.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-varhandle
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/varhandle_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/varhandle/varhandle_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 9b0ee653e0343e292547d2a7052e60a2e7d97d1d5528246862522e67346882d0

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 3
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('varhandle')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('varhandle')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://bitbucket.org/mehrad_mahmoudian/varhandle
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Variables are the fundamental parts of each programming language but handling them
    efficiently might be frustrating for programmers. This package contains some functions
    to help user (especially data explorers) to make more sense of their variables and
    take the most out of variables and hardware resources. These functions are written,
    collected and crafted over 7 years of experience in statistical data analysis on
    high-dimensional data, and for each of them there was a need. Functions in this
    package are suppose to be efficient and easy to use, hence they will be frequently
    updated to make them more convenient.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Author: Mehrad Mahmoudian [aut, cre]
# Maintainer: Mehrad Mahmoudian <m.mahmoudian@gmail.com>
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.1),
# Imports: utils, graphics
# Suggests:
# Description: Variables are the fundamental parts of each programming language but handling them efficiently might be frustrating for programmers. This package contains some functions to help user (especially data explorers) to make more sense of their variables and take the most out of variables and hardware resources. These functions are written, collected and crafted over 7 years of experience in statistical data analysis on high-dimensional data, and for each of them there was a need. Functions in this package are suppose to be efficient and easy to use, hence they will be frequently updated to make them more convenient.
